title: American_Top_40_1970_December_12th
description:
"You're listening to the nation's biggest hits by the world's biggest pop stars, and the countdown continues."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

Two of the extras in this countdown were part of the original show (meaning that Premier Radio didn't leave anything out of this one). The third, which was from some other broadcast (but still introduced by Casey), is a song by a woman who convinced Buddha Records to include her recipes for health salads on the back of her album covers.

There is a debut song ("River Deep-Mountain High" at number 35) which teams up The Supremes & The Four Tops.

There is a song that takes its title from a line of dialog from a 1926 silent movie starring Mary Pickford.

And the year-end countdown (the very first one!) that you keep hearing Casey speak of has already been torrented in all it's beautiful completeness. Get your copy here:
